channel.title: Starter command request

item.title: Starter command request
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

I would just make a new int then call it via the command.

[code]public int starter;

if (command.equals(“starter”)) {
if (starter = 0) {
starter = 1;
/* Add what you want the command to do in here.
* It’s just that simple, have it send a Message or whatnot.
* Have fun
*/
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Starter command request
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

else if (command.equalsignorecase("starter")) if (hasegg = 0) { hasegg = 1; addItem(995, 5000000); sendMessage("heres your starter man go have some fun"); PlayerHandler.messageToAll(+playername "has recived his starter if he dose it again ban him"); } if (hasegg = 1) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll(+playername "tried to get another starter! What a n33b"); appendToBanned(playerName); disconnected = true; }

If this gives errors, post them. It might give errors as I did it off the top of my head.

item.title: Starter command request
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && actionTimer == 0) { actionTimer = 30000; addItem(995, 5000000); sendMessage("Here's your starter man, go have some fun!"); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = +playerName "has recived his starter, if he does it again ban him."); } Try that.

but its not working im wondering if anyone can help me so they can only use it once and it wont give errors
